item.title: Next Generation Pageranking
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Don’t mind me. I’m just doing a little pagerank work for my unborn son.
Boy genius.
First blogging billionaire?
America’s first Rabbi President.
Beyonce’s daughter takes a lover.
Straight A grades. Rock hard abs.
He looks like his mother.
And the Academy Award goes to…
American conquers the grass of Wimbledon (but still loses to dad in straight sets).
Saying no to cannibalism
Web 16.0 [...]

item.title: The Sopranos on the Shrink’s Couch
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Even those of us who consider ourselves semi-pro television watchers might have trouble keeping up with the densely packed metaphors, call-backs, and foreshadowing in each episode of The Sopranos.
The SF Chronicle’s Tim Goodman does a great job of calling out a few items you might have missed in his blog.
He wastes no time pointing out [...]

item.title: Waiting for Herschel, Part 6
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Put togther crib. Check.
Take child safety courses. Check.
Be told by 15,000 people that we’re gonna be tired. Check.
Diapers, bottles, blankets, clothes, changing table. Check, check, check, check, check.
It still feels like there’s something I’m forgetting. Hmmmm.
Oh yeah. The last detail before we’re ready for Herschel.
Check.

item.title: 124 Was Spiteful. Book Reviewers Were Not.
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
The NY Times got a bunch of reviewers to take a stab at making a list of the Best Work of American Fiction of the Last 25 Years.
Beloved took the top spot. The fact that I did my senior thesis on that novel just a brief year after its release likely played only a small [...]

item.title: Waiting for Herschel, Part 5: Power Tools
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
As the date draws nearer, I find myself at places like the Container Store pretty often.
Yesterday, I used a drill.*
*(I’m Jewish)

item.title: Al Gore to the Rescue
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
There was a time, not too long ago when one could have argued that a really top notch appearance on SNL could’ve saved Al Gore.
Who would’ve thought that by the time this week’s show hit the air, the opposite would be true.
Al Gore rescued SNL.

item.title: The War on the War on Terror
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
What comes first: Using our stretched guard services to help in the war on terror or to help lift low poll numbers and to play politics as usual?
Here’s your answer…

item.title: Webby Awards: Robbed Again
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Well, I guess I won’t be able to give my five word acceptance speech for my Webby Award over at Rollyo as I was robbed in favor of some rinky dink site called Google.
I guess I will go with one of my alternate 5 word speeches:
1. Google will pay for this. 2. Shit. Shit. Shit. Darn. [...]

item.title: Why Does Apple Hate Me
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Apple, why do you hate me?
I am one of your most loyal users and evangelists. Some people couldn’t imagine marrying someone from another religion or political party. I couldn’t imagine marrying a Windows user.
I buy your stuff. All the time. Even when I don’t need it. I walk through your stores and rub my fleshy [...]

item.title: Almost Famous
item.dc:creator: Dave
item.description:
Mahmoud Ahmadinejad clearly wants to be famous. And this kind of megalomania is a key driver behind the psyches of really bad leaders on the international stage.
To a certain extent, the Bush administration has probably helped to kickstart the effort. But this dude wants the world’s attention in a big way and that’s always bad [...]
